item.title: Property Testing in C++
item.description: Currently, I'm on a testing kick. One might say tests are shiny. I don't know if they are really shiny as much as I found another cool use for uniform_int_distribution<>. A use which, as a side effect, might make me appear to be a better software developer. (This assumes a negative bug rate is proportional to better software). I've started playing with Property Testing. Property Testing is a form of unit testing where the programmers defines properties, or invariants about the code. A framework library (ok, seriously its a framework because it calls your code) generates random constrained inputs and calls your test functions. It's pretty cool, and while I was playing around with the framework, I found a real bug, related to my ignorance of C++'s auto type deduction.
